page.title: 07My Day: Paul aged 9. Whitby.
page.content: My alarm clock wakes me at 7.45.I eat Weetabix cereal for breakfast. I get dressed, wake my mum, wash, brush my teeth and read a comic.At 8.30 I set off for school. I arrive at 8.45.At 9.00 the bell goes, my teacher marks the register and we all go to assembly.We have lessons until lunchtime at 12.00.I eat a hot school meal in our dining room with a 100 other children.Afternoon lessons take place between 1.15p.m. and 3.35p.m.My mum works in a children's clothes shop in Whitby and my dad is an engineer.He works at{Fylingdales,}a top secret early warning station which listens out for enemy attack. My favourite meal is cod bites, mushroom pizza, chips, beans and gravy.I like watching sport and cartoons on television.I have a bath nightly and go to bed at 8.30p.m.
